translations.english_saheeh: The Inevitable Reality -
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Inevitable (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)!
translations.english_rwwad: The Inevitable Hour!

translations.english_saheeh: What is the Inevitable Reality?
translations.english_hilali_khan: What is the Inevitable?
translations.english_rwwad: What is the Inevitable Hour?

translations.english_saheeh: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And what will make you know what the Inevitable is?
translations.english_rwwad: How do you know what the Inevitable Hour is?

translations.english_saheeh: Thamūd and ʿAad denied the Striking Calamity [i.e., the Resurrection].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thamûd and ‘Âd people denied the Qâri‘ah (the striking Hour of Judgement)!
translations.english_rwwad: Thamūd and ‘Ād denied the striking calamity of the Hour.

translations.english_saheeh: So as for Thamūd, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].
translations.english_hilali_khan: As for Thamûd, they were destroyed by the awful cry!
translations.english_rwwad: As for Thamūd, they were destroyed by a dreadful blast.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا عَادٞ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِرِيحٖ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٖ

translations.english_saheeh: And as for ʿAad, they were destroyed by a screaming,[1737] violent wind
translations.english_hilali_khan: And as for ‘Âd, they were destroyed by a furious violent wind!
translations.english_rwwad: And as for ‘Ād, they were destroyed by a furious windstorm

arabic_text: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَيَالٖ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومٗاۖ فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِيهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِيَةٖ
phonetic: 69.7 Sakhkharahā `Alayhim Sab`a Layālin Wa Thamāniyata 'Ayyāmin Ĥusūmāan Fatará Al-Qawma Fīhā Şar`á Ka'annahum 'A`jāzu Nakhlin Khāwiyahin

translations.english_saheeh: Which He [i.e., Allāh] imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Which Allâh imposed on them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so that you could see men lying overthrown (destroyed), as if they were hollow trunks of date-palms!
translations.english_rwwad: which He unleashed against them for seven successive nights and eight days, so you would see the people lying dead as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

translations.english_saheeh: Then do you see of them any remains?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Do you see any remnants of them?
translations.english_rwwad: Do you see any trace of them now?

arabic_text: وَجَآءَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَن قَبۡلَهُۥ وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلۡخَاطِئَةِ
phonetic: 69.9 Wa Jā'a Fir`awnu Wa Man Qablahu Wa Al-Mu'utafikātu Bil-Khāţi'ahi

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1738]- Those to which Lot was sent (see 11:82-83) or generally, all cities which were destroyed due to their denial of a messenger from Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities[1738] with sin.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Fir‘aun (Pharaoh), and those before him, and the cities overthrown [the towns of the people of [Lût (Lot)] committed sin.
translations.english_rwwad: Also Pharaoh and those who came before him, and the overturned cities [of Lot] committed grave sin,

arabic_text: فَعَصَوۡاْ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ أَخۡذَةٗ رَّابِيَةً

translations.english_saheeh: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they disobeyed their Lord’s Messenger, so He seized them with a strong punishment.
translations.english_rwwad: each disobeying the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a severe punishment.

arabic_text: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلۡمَآءُ حَمَلۡنَٰكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡجَارِيَةِ
phonetic: 69.11 'Innā Lammā Ţaghá Al-Mā'u Ĥamalnākum Fī Al-Jāriyahi

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried you [i.e., your ancestors] in the sailing ship[1739]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, when the water rose beyond its limits [Nûh’s (Noah) Flood], We carried you (mankind) in the floating [ship that was constructed by Nûh (Noah)]
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, when the floodwater overflowed, We carried you [O humans] in the sailing Ark,

arabic_text: لِنَجۡعَلَهَا لَكُمۡ تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٞ وَٰعِيَةٞ
phonetic: 69.12 Linaj`alahā Lakum Tadhkiratan Wa Ta`iyahā 'Udhunun Wā`iyahun

translations.english_saheeh: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.
translations.english_hilali_khan: That We might make it (Noah’s ship) an admonition for you and that it might be retained by the retaining ears.
translations.english_rwwad: so that We might make it a reminder for you, and that attentive ears may take heed.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ نَفۡخَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ
phonetic: 69.13 Fa'idhā Nufikha Fī Aş-Şūri Nafkhatun Wāĥidahun

translations.english_saheeh: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then when the Trumpet will be blown with one blowing (the first one).
translations.english_rwwad: Then when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast,

arabic_text: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ
phonetic: 69.14 Wa Ĥumilati Al-'Arđu Wa Al-Jibālu Fadukkatā Dakkatan Wāĥidahan

translations.english_saheeh: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow [i.e., stroke] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the earth and the mountains shall be removed from their places, and crushed with a single crushing.
translations.english_rwwad: and the earth and mountains are lifted up and crushed with a single blow,

translations.english_saheeh: Then on that Day, the Occurrence [i.e., Resurrection] will occur,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then on that Day shall the (Great) Event befall.
translations.english_rwwad: on that Day the Inevitable Event will occur.

phonetic: 69.16 Wa Anshaqqati As-Samā'u Fahiya Yawma'idhin Wa Ahiyahun

translations.english_saheeh: And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.[1740]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the heaven will be rent asunder, for that Day it (the heaven) will be frail and torn up.
translations.english_rwwad: And the sky will split asunder and will be frail on that day,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرۡجَآئِهَاۚ وَيَحۡمِلُ عَرۡشَ رَبِّكَ فَوۡقَهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ ثَمَٰنِيَةٞ
phonetic: 69.17 Wa Al-Malaku `Alá 'Arjā'ihā Wa Yaĥmilu `Arsha Rabbika Fawqahum Yawma'idhin Thamāniyahun

translations.english_saheeh: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the angels will be on its sides, and eight angels will, that Day, bear the Throne of your Lord above them.
translations.english_rwwad: with the angels on all its sides, and on that Day, eight [mighty angels] will bear the Throne of your Lord above them.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُعۡرَضُونَ لَا تَخۡفَىٰ مِنكُمۡ خَافِيَةٞ
phonetic: 69.18 Yawma'idhin Tu`rađūna Lā Takhfá Minkum Khāfiyahun

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1741]- i.e., any person or any secret you might attempt to conceal.

translations.english_saheeh: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.[1741]
translations.english_hilali_khan: That Day shall you be brought to Judgement, not a secret of you will be hidden.
translations.english_rwwad: On that day, you will be brought forth [before Allah], and none of your secrets will remain hidden.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقۡرَءُواْ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ
phonetic: 69.19 Fa'ammā Man 'Ūtiya Kitābahu Biyamīnihi Fayaqūlu Hā'uum Aqra'ū Kitābī

translations.english_saheeh: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then as for him who will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Here! read my Record!
translations.english_rwwad: As for the one who is given his Record in his right hand, he will say, “Here is my Record, read it!

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Surely, I did believe that I shall meet my Account!"
translations.english_rwwad: I was sure that I would meet my reckoning.”

translations.english_saheeh: So he will be in a pleasant life -
translations.english_hilali_khan: So he shall be in a life, well-pleasing.
translations.english_rwwad: So he will be in a pleasant life,

translations.english_saheeh: In an elevated garden,
translations.english_hilali_khan: In a lofty Paradise,
translations.english_rwwad: in a lofty garden,

translations.english_saheeh: Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The fruits in bunches whereof will be low and near at hand.
translations.english_rwwad: with clustered fruit within his reach.

arabic_text: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَآ أَسۡلَفۡتُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَيَّامِ ٱلۡخَالِيَةِ
phonetic: 69.24 Kulū Wa Ashrabū Hanī'āan Bimā 'Aslaftum Fī Al-'Ayyāmi Al-Khāliyahi

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1742]- Literally, "advanced" in anticipation of reward in the Hereafter.

translations.english_saheeh: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth[1742] in the days past."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Eat and drink at ease for that which you have sent on before you in days past!
translations.english_rwwad: [They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully for what you did in the days gone by.”

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي لَمۡ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ
phonetic: 69.25 Wa 'Ammā Man 'Ūtiya Kitābahu Bishimālihi Fayaqūlu Yā Laytanī Lam 'Ūta Kitābīh

translations.english_saheeh: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record
translations.english_hilali_khan: But as for him who will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "I wish that I had not been given my Record!
translations.english_rwwad: As for the one who is given his Record in his left hand, he will say, “Would that I had not been given my Record,

translations.english_saheeh: And had not known what is my account.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And that I had never known how my Account is!
translations.english_rwwad: nor had I known anything of my reckoning!

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1743]- i.e., ending life rather than being the gateway to eternal life.

translations.english_saheeh: I wish it [i.e., my death] had been the decisive one.[1743]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Would that it had been my end (death)!
translations.english_rwwad: Would that it [death] had been the end of me!

translations.english_saheeh: My wealth has not availed me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "My wealth has not availed me;
translations.english_rwwad: My wealth has been of no avail to me.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1744]- i.e., I have no valid excuse to stand on.

translations.english_saheeh: Gone from me is my authority."[1744]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "My power (and arguments to defend myself) have gone from me!"
translations.english_rwwad: My authority has vanished.”

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It will be said): "Seize him and fetter him;
translations.english_rwwad: [It will be said,] “Seize him and shackle him,

translations.english_saheeh: Then into Hellfire drive him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then throw him in the blazing Fire.
translations.english_rwwad: then make him burn in the Blazing Fire,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ فِي سِلۡسِلَةٖ ذَرۡعُهَا سَبۡعُونَ ذِرَاعٗا فَٱسۡلُكُوهُ
phonetic: 69.32 Thumma Fī Silsilatin Dhar`uhā Sab`ūna Dhirā`āan Fāslukūhu

translations.english_saheeh: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Then fasten him with a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits!"
translations.english_rwwad: then tie him up with chain of seventy cubits long.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allāh, the Most Great,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, he used not to believe in Allâh, the Most Great,
translations.english_rwwad: For he did not believe in Allah, the Most Great,

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.69:34)
a) See the footnote of (V.2:83).
b) Narrated ‘Abdullâh bin ‘Amr رضي الله عنه: A man asked the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم, "What sort of deeds (or what qualities) of Islâm are good?" The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم replied, "To feed (the poor) and greet those whom you know and those whom you do not know". (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.1, Hadith No.11).

translations.english_saheeh: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And urged not on the feeding of Al-Miskîn (the poor).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: nor did he encourage feeding the needy.

translations.english_saheeh: So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
translations.english_hilali_khan: So no friend has he here this Day,
translations.english_rwwad: So Today he will have no close friend here,

translations.english_saheeh: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nor any food except filth from the washing of wounds.
translations.english_rwwad: nor any food except the discharge of wounds,

translations.english_saheeh: None will eat it except the sinners.
translations.english_hilali_khan: None will eat it except the Khâti’ûn (sinners, disbelievers, polytheists).
translations.english_rwwad: none will eat it except the sinners.”

translations.english_saheeh: So I swear by what you see
translations.english_hilali_khan: So I swear by whatsoever you see,
translations.english_rwwad: I swear by what you can see.

translations.english_saheeh: And what you do not see
translations.english_hilali_khan: And by whatsoever you see not,
translations.english_rwwad: and what you cannot see!

translations.english_saheeh: [That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the word of a noble Messenger.
translations.english_hilali_khan: That this is verily, the word of an honoured Messenger [i.e. Jibrîl (Gabriel) or Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم which he has brought from Allâh].
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, this is the word of a noble Messenger,

arabic_text: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَاعِرٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تُؤۡمِنُونَ
phonetic: 69.41 Wa Mā Huwa Biqawli Shā`irin Qalīlāan Mā Tu'uminūna

translations.english_saheeh: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It is not the word of a poet: little is that you believe!
translations.english_rwwad: and it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe!

arabic_text: وَلَا بِقَوۡلِ كَاهِنٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
phonetic: 69.42 Wa Lā Biqawli Kāhinin Qalīlāan Mā Tadhakkarūna

translations.english_saheeh: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer (or a foreteller): little is that you remember!
translations.english_rwwad: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer; little do you take heed!

translations.english_saheeh: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: This is the Revelation sent down from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

translations.english_saheeh: And if he [i.e., Muḥammad] had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And if he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) had forged a false saying concerning Us (Allâh جل جلاله),
translations.english_rwwad: If he had falsely attributed something to Us,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1745]- Another interpretation is "by [Our] right hand," i.e., Allāh would have exacted revenge with might and power.

translations.english_saheeh: We would have seized him by the right hand;[1745]
translations.english_hilali_khan: We surely would have seized him by his right hand (or with power and might),
translations.english_rwwad: We would have surely seized him by the right hand,

translations.english_saheeh: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.[1746]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And then We certainly would have cut off his life artery (aorta),
translations.english_rwwad: then severed his aorta,

arabic_text: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ عَنۡهُ حَٰجِزِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And none of you could have withheld Us from (punishing) him.
translations.english_rwwad: and none of you could have rescued him.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder for the righteous.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, this (Qur’an) is a Reminder for the Muttaqûn (the pious. See V.2:2).
translations.english_rwwad: This [Qur’an] is indeed a reminder for those who are righteous.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, We know that there are some among you that belie (this Qur’ân). (Tafsir At-Tabarî)
translations.english_rwwad: And We surely know that some of you will be deniers,

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed it (this Qur’ân) will be an anguish for the disbelievers (on the Day of Resurrection).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: and it will certainly be a source of regret for the disbelievers.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, it (this Qur’ân) is an absolute truth with certainty.[2]
translations.english_rwwad: And this is indeed the absolute truth.

translations.english_saheeh: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.[3]
translations.english_rwwad: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
